TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowTrackingRecord extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingRecord

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains the data sent to the tracking service by the runtime tracking infrastructure when it matches a . It is also used in the return list of the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackPoint> in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile>, it sends a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord> to the tracking service over the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingChannel> associated with that tracking service. The tracking service can perform whatever action is necessary on the data in the tracking record.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The constructor is called by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified value, , number, and .

remarks.format:
## Remarks `eventDateTime` is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). `eventOrder` is guaranteed to be unique within the workflow instance; however, it is not guaranteed to be sequential.
This constructor is called by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an that contains additional data associated with certain types of workflow status events.
Docs.value: Either a , a , a , or a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

remarks.format:
## Remarks For most workflow status events, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> is a null reference (`Nothing`); however, for certain kinds of workflow status events the runtime tracking infrastructure uses <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> to return additional data about the workflow status event. The following table lists the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> values that correspond to these special workflow status events and the type of object returned in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> for each of these workflow status events.
|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> Value|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> Object| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent.Exception>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowExceptionEventArgs>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent.Suspended>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowSuspendedEventArgs>| |<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent.Terminated>|<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowTerminatedEventArgs>|
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the order in the workflow instance of the workflow status event that matched the .
Docs.value: A value that indicates the order of the workflow status event in the workflow instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventOrder%2A> indicates the relative order in the workflow instance of the workflow status event that matched the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackPoint>. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventOrder%2A> is unique within a workflow instance, but it is not guaranteed to be sequential.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent TrackingWorkflowEvent { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent TrackingWorkflowEvent
Public Property TrackingWorkflowEvent As TrackingWorkflowEvent

public: property System::Workflow::Runtime::Tracking::TrackingWorkflowEvent TrackingWorkflowEvent { System::Workflow::Runtime::Tracking::TrackingWorkflowEvent get(); void set(System::Workflow::Runtime::Tracking::TrackingWorkflowEvent value); };
member this.TrackingWorkflowEvent : System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of workflow status event associated with the tracking record.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `TrackingWorkflowEvent` contains one of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent> values indicating the kind of workflow status event that was matched by the runtime tracking infrastructure and caused the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord> to be sent. It reflects the current status of the workflow instance. A workflow instance emits workflow status events only when the status of the workflow instance changes, and, therefore, a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackPoint> can be matched only when a workflow status change occurs.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.
